example_sentence: The philosopher's theories were so abstruse that few could fully grasp them.
Their divorce was an acrimonious affair, marked by bitter accusations.

chinese_meaning: 時代錯誤；不合時宜的人事物
example_sentence: A typewriter in a modern office building is an anachronism.
The weather in the mountains can be very capricious.
He was accused of chicanery and dishonesty in business dealings.
We must be cognizant of the potential risks involved.
The film explores the dichotomy between good and evil.
It was disingenuous of him to pretend he didn't know about the problem.
He was a strict vegetarian who eschewed all meat products.
'Passed away' is a common euphemism for 'died'.
He's very fastidious about his appearance and always dresses impeccably.

chinese_meaning: 好交際的；群居的 (重複但適用於C2語境)
example_sentence: Though a brilliant academic, he was not particularly gregarious outside of conferences.
The fall of the empire marked the end of its global hegemony.
One of his idiosyncrasies was his habit of always wearing odd socks.
The manager suspected he was malingering to avoid the difficult assignment.
The new employee was overly obsequious towards the CEO.
Some people believe that technology is a panacea for all societal problems.

chinese_meaning: 有害的；惡性的 (重複但適用於C2語境)
example_sentence: The pernicious effects of corporate greed on society cannot be overstated.
He has a propensity for exaggeration when telling stories.

chinese_meaning: 頑固的；不服從的 (重複但適用於C2語境)
example_sentence: The school struggled to manage the recalcitrant students who constantly disrupted classes.
He was reticent about his past, revealing little to anyone.
The spy used a clever subterfuge to escape detection.
They held surreptitious meetings to plan their protest.

chinese_meaning: 微弱的；稀薄的；站不住腳的
example_sentence: Their claim to the property was based on a tenuous connection to the original owner.
He has a voracious appetite for knowledge, constantly reading books.
